meanings.definition: The state or quality of being wobbly or unsteady.
meanings.sent1: The wobblinesses of the table made the dishes clink together.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the wobblinesses of the ladder as she climbed up.
meanings.sent3: The wobblinesses of the jelly made it dance on the plate.
meanings.sent4: His voice had a wobblinesses that mirrored his nervousness.
meanings.sent5: The wobblinesses of the bridge made crossing it an adventure.

meanings.definition: The tendency to wobble or sway.
meanings.sent1: The tree's wobblinesses in the wind worried the squirrel.
meanings.sent2: The boat's wobblinesses on the water made her seasick.
meanings.sent3: The wobblinesses of the dancer's legs added charm to the performance.
meanings.sent4: The wobblinesses of the old chair gave it character.
meanings.sent5: The wobblinesses of the toddler's steps were endearing to watch.

meanings.definition: The presence of instability or shakiness.
meanings.sent1: The wobblinesses of the building concerned the engineers.
meanings.sent2: The wobblinesses of his voice revealed his nervousness.
meanings.sent3: The wobblinesses of the jello amused the children at the party.
meanings.sent4: The wobblinesses of the economy made investors cautious.
meanings.sent5: The wobblinesses of the makeshift table made everyone nervous about placing heavy items on it.
